nost.config module¶

nost.observer module¶

class nost.observer.ExternalPublishObserver(client, topic, publish_step, publish_start_time=None)¶

Bases: nost.observer.Observer

This is the ExternalPublishObserver class which implements the abstract Observer class.

This class publishes time status messages at a interval defined during instantion and is removed after an execution completes. Publishes messages to “{prefix}/manager/time”

Parameters

  • client (paho.mqtt.client.Client) – Access to the MQTT client for publishing messages.

  • topic (str) – Topic to publish messages to.

  • publish_step (datetime.timedelta) – Execution time between published messages.

  • publish_start_time (datetime.datetime) – Specifies when to start publishing messages in execution time, defaults to None which will use simStartTime.

_client¶

Access to the MQTT client for publishing messages.

Type

paho.mqtt.client.Client

_topic¶

Topic to publish messages to.

Type

str

_publish_step¶

Execution time between published messages.

Type

datetime.timedelta

_next_publish_time¶

Specifies when to publish next message.

Type

datetime.datetime

on_change(source, property_name, old_value, new_value)¶

Publishes nost/time Messages

class nost.observer.ModeMessageObserver(client, prefix)¶

Bases: nost.observer.Observer

This is the ModeMessageObserver class which implements the abstract Observer class.

This class publishes mode status updates of the simulator class.

Parameters

  • client (paho.mqtt.client.Client) – Access to the MQTT client for publishing messages.

  • prefix (str) – Prefix of specified execution.

class nost.observer.TestScriptObserver(sim, client, prefix, test_script_data)¶

Bases: nost.observer.Observer

This is the TestScriptObserver class which implements the abstract Observer class.

This class executes time status updates predefined by a test script.

Parameters

  • sim (nost.simulator.Simulator) – Simulator class to execute commands directly to execution state.

  • client (paho.mqtt.client.Client) – Access to the MQTT client for publishing messages.

  • prefix (str) – Prefix of specified execution.

  • test_script_data (list) – State updates over the execution.

_sim¶

Simulator class to execute commands directly to execution state.

Type

nost.simulator.Simulator

_client¶

Access to the MQTT client for publishing messages.

Type

paho.mqtt.client.Client

_prefix¶

Prefix of specified execution.

Type

str

_data¶

State updates over the execution.

Type

list

_length¶

Amount of state updates.

Type

int

_index¶

Index of next state update.

Type

int

_next_time¶

Time of next state update.

Type

datetime.datetime

on_change(source, property_name, old_value, new_value)¶

On change function observing execution time to issue time-based updates.

set_next_time(data)¶

Sets next time to execute update.

class nost.simulator.Simulator(wallclock_offset=datetime.timedelta(0), verbose=False)¶

Bases: nost.observer.Observable

This is the Simulator class which inherit the observable.

Parameters

  • wallclock_offset (datetime.timedelta) – Offset from the system clock defined by NTP atomic clock, defaults to 0.

  • verbose (bool) – Determines whether logs are shown.

_wallclock_offset¶

Offset from the system clock defined by NTP atomic clock, defaults to 0.

Type

datetime.timedelta

_entities¶

List of entities that participate in this simulation.

list

Adds a simulation entity.

Execute a simulation for a given duration with uniform time steps.

Removes a simulation entity.

Set the simulation duration.

set_end_time(end_time)¶

Set the simulation end time.

set_mode(mode)¶

Sets the current simulation state and notifies observers.

set_time_scale_factor(time_scale_factor, simulation_epoch)¶

Set the simulation time scale factor (>1 is faster-than-real-time).

set_time_step(time_step)¶

Set the simulation time step.

set_wallclock_offset(wallclock_offset)¶

Set the wallclock offset.

terminate()¶

Terminate the simulation execution.

tick(time_step)¶

Computes the state transitions for a time step duration.

tock()¶

Commits the state transitions.

wait_for_tock()¶

Wait to tock until the “correct” next wallclock time.

wait_for_wallclock_epoch()¶

Wait to start the simulation until the wallclock epoch.
